column5: Since we have a lot of members that depend on the Kawartha Lakes it would be appreciated if this could get pinned just until the danger has past.  http://www.kawarthaconservation.com/floodforecast/index.html  Thanks  Cliff
Yes, I also think it's worthy of a PIN. Thanks Cliff.
How is Coboconk or Fenelon Falls doing?
http://www.pc.gc.ca/lhn-nhs/on/trentsevern/visit/ne-wl/trent_e.asp  This link will give you all the water levels for each lock in the trent severn.  S
Put out 150 sandbags at a buddy of mines place last night it's creeping up to his house pretty quickly. Man my shoulders are sore today.

Evidence of flooding on Lower Buckhorn from Reach Harbour Resort's webcam showing their dock  just about under water http://www.reachharbour.com/ just click on the webcam button at the top left of the page to update the camera image. Also here is another webcam from Sunrise Resort just beside the lock on Lower Buckhorn however it has been taken down at the moment due to flooding hopefully they will get it back up soon http://www.sunriseresort.ca/index.php/photo-video/webcam. Hopefully it drops soon.  Kawartha Kev
Went to Port Perry at noon today,the water has the boat launch covered and no ice to be seen from there.  vance
Structures are under water below Lock 19 in Peterborough.
Sturgeon Lake seems to be fairly stable right now high but holding.
The water is as high as I've ever seen it on Buckhorn (Tri-Lakes), but seems to have stabilized since Friday.  Good news is the ice mostly left overnight.
Nogies Bay (Pigeon Lake) is half ice covered and most of the north end of pigeon is ice covered...  Water is up and over some docks...

Flood waters are now receding in the Kawarthas and it seems that for the most part danger has passed for our area at least.  Roy, thank you for pinning this but I guess it could be un pinned now to leave room for other important things!  Thanks!  Big Cliff
Rice lake is still under flood warnings, and still rising.  S.

Rice lake is still under flood warnings, and still rising.  S.  Little Lake in Peterborough is right in the midst of it as well. http://www.ptbocanada.com/journal/2014/4/17/look-flooding-in-peterborough

If you've ever wondered why the ground floor rooms at the Holiday Inn always smell a little musty...  Not good... should be about a foot shy of going over the street and into the houses on the South shore.
Yeah we are across the shore from the twin islands outside of nogies creek.  Our dock normally sits about 1.5-2 feet out of the water. If we had it in it would be completely submerged  by a foot.
as of today the gull river watershed and minden is under a flood watch again !!!!!
